title: Compile-time type list abstraction
body_html:
This is a prerequisite for the c10 work.
It adds a type list abstraction that can be used at compile time to analyze operators, their argument types, figure out how many of the operator arguments are tensor types, call arbitrary operator signatures in a type safe way, and so on.

Currently, this isn't included into the build system yet, because that is blocked on @orionr 's build system work. Locally, however, I included it into the build system in a hacky way and it works. I will integrate this into Orion's work once he is ready.

body:
This is a prerequisite for the c10 work. 
It adds a type list abstraction that can be used at compile time to analyze operators, their argument types, figure out how many of the operator arguments are tensor types, call arbitrary operator signatures in a type safe way, and so on.

Currently, this isn't included into the build system yet, because that is blocked on @orionr 's build system work. Locally, however, I included it into the build system in a hacky way and it works. I will integrate this into Orion's work once he is ready.
